meanings.definition: To spin or whirl around quickly.
meanings.sent1: The colorful pinwheel birled in the wind.
meanings.sent2: She birled around the dance floor with grace.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel birled around the tree, trying to escape.
meanings.sent4: The tornado birled through the town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The figure skater birled effortlessly on the ice, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.sent1: The helicopter blades birled above our heads.
meanings.sent2: He birled the rope around the pole to secure it.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat birled its tail in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds birled ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The whirlpool birled violently, pulling everything towards its center.

meanings.definition: To cause something to rotate or spin quickly.
meanings.sent1: The magician birled the colorful scarves in the air.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind birled the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child birled the top, making it spin wildly.
meanings.sent4: The chef birled the pizza dough expertly in the air.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind birled the umbrella inside out.
